result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dajon Damarion Malone

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dajon Damarion Malone appeared by video.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Dajon Damarion Malone.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant has a felony matter in Branch 40. Court will authorize transfer for resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report Received and Filed.

Case rescheduled due to court congestion. Case rescheduled via email. Defense is working with the State on a potential global plea deal.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case calendared for Plea and Sentencing June 27, 2022.  Attorney Wineke in trial.  Case adjourned for Plea and Senencing July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.  bm

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Dajon Damarion Malone in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Dajon Damarion Malone in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Dajon Damarion Malone not in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/4/22 @ 1:30p
